originalText.text: Leaving a perfectly legal character review of this company, I recommend looking at past reviews, even though some were taken off. They donâ€™t hold their end on promises with customers and most importantly the hardworking people that work for them that help grow/build the company. Spend your money and time with a company with better character. Will never recommend this company or century21 as a whole. DO YOUR RESEARCH!

originalText.text: I worked with a wonderful agent, Pablo A Martinez from Scope Realty Bx, a young, professional and very respectful agent, to buy an apartment in Jackson Heights ,NY; after making the deal with the seller, we decided it is time to start with documentation; I am paying cash for the apartment; I am retired making more than enough money to pay for $526 maintenance monthly payment; however, when I sent the documents to this lady, Shirley Chan ,I started having problems; she never introduced herself ,she started sending me copies from my IRS taxes asking for all kind of info that had nothing to do with  the selling itself(since my credit is almost perfect), I am an excellent payer(from Experian),I have Bank recommendation about the amount I have and how clean my account is; there is NO REASON for this Lady to be so aggressive, rude ,arrogant and unprofessional with me; I told her that what she's asking about it is not a part of our deal, and I called my lawyer to talk to her about the situation ;SHE CONTINUED TO BE NASTY AND AGGRESSIVE TO EVERYONE, and ended up by retaliating against me and refuse to continue the process; she emphatically sustained that she just "made some millions from selling". Horrible  behavior   in any sense. I have to start the process again with my wonderful agent Pablo Martinez. who did his best for this sale to happen. I AM HAPPY WITH HIS SERVICES AND VERYY DISSAPOINTED WITH THIS  SHIRLEY CHAN LADY(arrogant, unprofessional, nasty, revengeful /she should"t work with people)

Horrible  behavior   in any sense. I have to start the process again with my wonderful agent Pablo Martinez. who did his best for this sale to happen. I AM HAPPY WITH HIS SERVICES AND VERYY DISSAPOINTED WITH THIS  SHIRLEY CHAN LADY(arrogant, unprofessional, nasty, revengeful /she should"t work with people)

originalText.text:
Early March, I  connected with one of the agents here in New York to rent a room in an apartment with other roommates. Made a deposit for the room within two days of checking the place out while waiting to find an extra roommates. As the end of my current lease got closer, I communicated with the agent about the progress with getting a third person (even got the permission to advertise on various Facebook groups) Unfortunately none of the people that responded liked the room. My agent told me to start looking for other places as I had about a 10 days left to move and promised to start processing the refund of my deposit. I told her as soon ax I was able to find another place (about 6 days before moving) and she confirmed starting the refund process.

It's been almost 4 months now and I still haven't received my refund of $1425. After multiple requests, I got a supposedly positive update in May when I was told to come to the office in midtown to get a check. Got the check and was ordered by the receptionist to wait till the next day before cashing it, which I did. To my utter surprise, the check bounced after a couple days. This happened early June. I've tried reaching out multiple times afterwards (including calling, even filed a complaint with the franchise) but nothing ðŸ˜‘. This is worse as I was given reassurance about finally getting my refund only for the rug to be pulled from under my feet. Even got an overdraft from this.

I sent an email to the manager and other staff members back in mid-July from which i got a response to send my zelle information (which I did). Since then, I haven't heard back from them nor received my money.

Can't talk for the other companies under Century 21, but the people in the Manhattan's office are unreliable and untrustworthy. Working with them is a risk, which I didn't realize until it was too late due to their friendly facade.  Since no one is responding to me, I decided to make this public as it would be harder to ignore my issue here, also, warn others about the behavior of the people running this office.

Since no one is responding to me, I decided to make this public as it would be harder to ignore my issue here, also, warn others about the behavior of the people running this office.

originalText.text: I have been working here for the past four years. I came from another firm but what makes the most difference with this company is that they provide buyer and seller leads to their agents. Because of that I was able to close my first transaction within my first month working with Scope Realty.

originalText.text: BEWARE BEWARE BEWARE they literally steal agent's commissions and clients good faith deposit.  They have been reported to DOS, NMLS, HGAR, BBB, and have pending legal cases against Paul Reisner, Lauren Cohen (Gold or Reisner), and Emmanuel Pepe is their fugazi broker of record.  Dont waste your time, there are many reputable other brokerages out there that wont just straight up STEAL from you.
